Description: Plastic female head from Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; white slip; black decoration on veil, eyes, wavy hair, and necklace; archaic style evident in facial features, eyes, mouth and chin.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Site 2 (Hogarth) and Site 3 (Hogarth), 12" above mud [according to Ashmolean Museum register; no findspot given by Gutch]
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Such plastic heads would originally have been set at the root of amphora handles. For other Clazomenian plastic female heads, see Louvre CA1153 from Clazomenae and Heidelberg Inv. 10 from Corinth.
Bibliographic references: Hogarth 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, A. Site and Buildings (p. 76, no. 1, pl. X, no. 1)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 127, g)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 88, no. 23, pl. X, no. 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.091) (phase 3)
